1.text: Remove the seeds if you want to decrease the bitterness of your eggplant.

2.text: Slice your eggplant in half lengthwise.

3.text: Scrape out the seedy core using a metal spoon.

4.text: Use your kitchen knife to slice or cube the eggplant flesh.

5.text: Scoop the seeds out of an eggplant into a bowl of water.

6.text: Use your fingers to rub the seeds off the pulp and into the water.

7.text: Pour the water out through a mesh strainer and rinse the seeds with water.

8.text: Dry the seeds for 1-2 days in a well-ventilated area.

9.text: Store your dried seeds in a clean, dry container for up to 5 years.
